trans-unit.source: Represents an individual item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> class is used to represent an individual item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
An individual item usually represents a record in the underlying data source of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
Each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control has a designated item type, as listed in the following table.
Item type
Description
A data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
An insert item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
An empty item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

The empty item is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any records to display, or when a group in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any more records to display.
To determine the type of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A> property.
If an item contains other controls, you can retrieve a control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the item.
If the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property is set, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method to find the control.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> class.
Property
Initial value
The value of the `itemType` parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets or sets the underlying data object that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> object is bound to.
The underlying data object that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> object is bound to.
Gets the index of the data item that is bound to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> control.
The index of the data item that is bound to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> control.
Gets the position of the data item as displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The position of the data item as displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
Gets the item type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A> property to determine the type of item that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object represents, as listed in the following table.
Item type
Description
A data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
An insert item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
An empty item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

The empty item is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any records to display, or when a group in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any more records to display.
You typically use this property to determine an item's type before you perform an operation.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType"></xref> values.
Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
The event data.
`true` if the event has been canceled; otherwise, `false`.
